E. Clifton James]] posing as Field Marshall [[Bernard Montgomery, 1st Viscount Montgomery of Alamein|Bernard Montgomery]] in the build up to [[D-Day]]? |currentstatus=FA |topic=warfare |action2=WAR |action2date=09:23, 16 August 2013 (UTC) |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Operation Copperhead |action2result=approved |action2oldid=567240937 |maindate= 25 May 2016 |action3=FAC |action3date=2015-11-14 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Operation Copperhead/archive1 |action3result=promoted |action3oldid=690513439 }} {{WPMILHIST |class = FA |A-Class=pass |B-Class-1=yes |B-Class-2=yes |B-Class-3=yes |B-Class-4=yes |B-Class-5=yes |British=y |WWII=y |Intel-task-force=yes}} {{Talk:Operation Copperhead/GA1}} == General, not Field Marshal == Montgomery became Field Marshal 01.08.1944. During Operation Copperhead he was General. â€” Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/95.51.207.58|95.51.207.58]] ([[User talk:95.51.207.58|talk]]) 08:49, 28 February 2013 (UTC) == Anachronistic map == The map is of modern Europe; it'd be better to have one of Europe in 1944. [[User:Bthylafh|Bthylafh]] ([[User talk:Bthylafh|talk]]) 03:19, 25 May 2016 (UTC) == I was Monty's Treble == The [[Goon Show]] did a skit episode called ''I was Monty's Treble'' in homage to this historical deception. Is it worth mentioning this in the article??? [[User:Montalban|Montalban]] ([[User talk:Montalban|talk]]) 08:12, 25 May 2016 (UTC) :I'd usually class stuff like that as pop culture; it would have to have (IMO) important context for the article (e.g. an unusual or new historical interpretation). On the flip side, it's worth mentioning in a Goon show article! --'''[[user:ErrantX|Errant]]''' ([[User_talk:ErrantX|chat!]]) 14:21, 25 May 2016 (UTC)
